entry.title: Williamsburg Bray School (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Williamsburg Bray School – the "oldest extant building in the United States dedicated to the education of Black children" – was moved a second time in February 2023 (pictured)?

entry.title: Gloria Cameron (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Gloria Cameron was the first native Jamaican in the UK to appear on the British television programme This Is Your Life?

entry.title: Gimix (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Gimix acknowledged in 1980 that its computer for home automation was like a "Hollywood-type toy"?

entry.title: London's Brilliant Parade (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that on his 1994 song "London's Brilliant Parade", Elvis Costello used a Dobro guitar as an homage to the Kinks' "Lola"?

entry.title: Dan McCrum (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that when investigative journalist Dan McCrum published his findings of the Wirecard scandal, German authorities investigated him instead of the company?

entry.title: fatally shot a police officer (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a Texas man who, on his front porch, fatally shot a police officer was acquitted of murder?

entry.title: The Mercy Journals (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the post-apocalyptic novel The Mercy Journals was inspired by the Gombe Chimpanzee War, the Rwandan genocide, and the Bible?

entry.title: Mobius I (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that naming every character "Bob" was common in the play-by-mail game Mobius I?
